column4: hey, how do i set the defualt application for specific file types? (outside of nautilus i need the search application to use it)
editing ~/.local/share/applications/defaults.list  should help
do you know the syntax of the lines im ment to put in? mines empty
i beleive you can follow the format of the global equivalent - which should be at /usr/share/gnome/applications/defaults.list
THANKS! i needed to know where the global one was :-D
i edited the defualts.list and still the same thing
still the same thing meaning the default app was not changed?
yeah
ok, what did you put in defaults.list?
audio/mpeg=foobar2000.desktop
just that line?
yeah
i think you need the very first line to say  [Default Applications]
yeah i was about to say thats at the top too
errm, i dunno what foobar2000.desktop does - but i suspect it's one you have created, verify that the file exists
ooh your right, for some reason the file has some crap at the end of the name, but i cant see it in nautilus
is there a way so i can see the full filenames in nautilus, including the .desktop part
errm, i don't know, i don't use nautilus very much.
what do you use? nautilus is pretty bad...
I use the terminal and midnight commander
my foobar.desktop is actually called userapp-foobar2000-XA2TGU.desktop ... cool
thanks for your help :-)
